intro: Hibiscus setosus, commonly known as the bristly hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy, bristly stems and large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Hibiscus setosus thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
